description: Borrowed from French préposer; prefix pré- (Latin prae before) with poser. See pose.

verbs.description: prepose (third-person singular simple present preposes, present participle preposing, simple past and past participle preposed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To place or set before; to prefix.
examples: Otherwise I would prepose Millington (first provost afterwards of King's in the reign of King Henry the Sixth) before Wilflete master under King Richard the Third
